channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The second integral homology of ${\rm SL}_2(\mathbb{Z}[1/n])$
item.description: arXiv:2503.12190v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this article, we explore the second integral homology, or Schur multiplier, of the special linear group ${\rm SL}_2(\mathbb{Z}[1/n])$ for a positive integer $n$. We definitively calculate the group structure of $H_2({\rm SL}_2(\mathbb{Z}[1/n]),\mathbb{Z})$ when $n$ is divisible by one of the primes $2$, $3$, $5$, $7$ or $13$. For a general $n > 1$, we offer a partial description by placing the homology group within an exact sequence, and we investigate its rank. Finally, we propose a conjectural structure for $H_2({\rm SL}_2(\mathbb{Z}[1/n]),\mathbb{Z})$ when $n$ is not divisible by any of those specific primes.
item.dc:creator: Behrooz Mirzaii, Bruno Reis Ramos, Thiago Verissimo

item.title: The Tate Intermediate Value Theorem
item.description: arXiv:2503.11719v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We explain how the gluing of a closed piece of the tensor-triangular spectrum with its open complement hinges on the support of the Tate ring.
item.dc:creator: Paul Balmer, Beren Sanders

item.title: Motivic stable stems and Galois approximations of cellular motivic categories
item.description: arXiv:2503.12060v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We reconstruct (appropriately completed) categories of cellular motivic spectra over fields of small cohomological dimension in terms of only their absolute Galois groups. As our main application, we determine the motivic stable stems (away from the characteristic) of almost all fields.
item.dc:creator: Tom Bachmann, Robert Burklund, Zhouli Xu

item.title: Parabolic noncommutative geometry
item.description: arXiv:2503.12938v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We introduce to spectral noncommutative geometry the notion of tangled spectral triple, which encompasses the anisotropies arising in parabolic geometry as well as the parabolic commutator bounds arising in so-called ``bad Kasparov products''. Tangled spectral triples incorporate anisotropy by replacing the unbounded operator in a spectral triple that mimics a Dirac operator with several unbounded operators mimicking directional Dirac operators. We allow for varying and dependent orders in different directions, controlled by using the tools of tropical combinatorics. We study the conformal equivariance of tangled spectral triples as well as how they fit into $K$-homology by means of producing higher order spectral triples. Our main examples are hypoelliptic spectral triples constructed from Rockland complexes on parabolic geometries; we also build spectral triples on nilpotent group $C^*$-algebras from the dual Dirac element and crossed product spectral triples for parabolic dynamical systems.
item.dc:creator: Magnus Fries, Magnus Goffeng, Ada Masters

item.title: Construction of logarithmic cohomology theories II: On Chow groups
item.description: arXiv:2503.12961v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The purpose of this second part of the series is to show a technical result on Chow groups of toric varieties. This is a crucial ingredient for the first part.
item.dc:creator: Doosung Park

item.title: The passage from the integral to the rational group ring in algebraic $K$-theory
item.description: arXiv:2110.01413v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: An open question is whether the map $\widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Z} G \rightarrow \widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Q} G$ in reduced $K$-theory from the integral to the rational group ring is trivial for any group $G$. We will show that this is false, with a counterexample given by the group $QD_{32} *_{Q_{16}} QD_{32}$. We will also show how to compute the image of the map $\widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Z} G \rightarrow \widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Q} G$ using representation theoretic means, assuming $G$ satisfies the Farrell-Jones conjecture.
item.dc:creator: Georg Lehner
